links.*: The Book of Lost Tales Part One

wikitext.*:
'''''Ramba''''' is a root [[Quenya]] noun and means "wall".<ref name="silmap">[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[Christopher Tolkien]] (ed.), ''[[the Silmarillion]]'', "Appendix: Elements in Quenya and Sindarin Names", entry ''ram''</ref>

Examples:
*[[Ilurambar]], "[[Walls of the World]]"<ref name="bolt">[[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[Christopher Tolkien]] (ed.), ''[[The Book of Lost Tales Part One]]'', "The Hiding of Valinor"</ref>

==See also==
*[[:Category:Walls]]
*''[[osto]]'', "fortress, walled city"
*''[[pelennor]]'', "fenced land"
*''[[ram]]'', "wall"; the Sindarin equivalent
